meanings.definition: A person or thing used to lure or entice someone or something into a trap.
meanings.sent1: The spy used decoys to distract the guards and sneak into the building.
meanings.sent2: Hunters use decoys to attract ducks and geese during hunting season.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox set up decoys to confuse the hunters and escape with the prize.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a decoy, hiding the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The shiny object acted as a decoy, drawing the attention away from the real treasure.

meanings.definition: An object used to attract birds or other animals for hunting purposes.
meanings.sent1: The hunter placed decoys of ducks in the pond to attract real ducks.
meanings.sent2: The decoys of rabbits helped the hunter catch the elusive prey.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon played with the decoys, thinking they were real animals.
meanings.sent4: The scarecrow in the field was a decoy, fooling the birds into staying away.
meanings.sent5: The decoys of songbirds successfully lured in a variety of colorful birds for observation.
